availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky to the Marshal of the City Court of Louisville
Greeting

Whereas I have this day received information on oath from Ethelinda Rielea that in said City, John Ritchie did under false and fraudulent pretences, and with a felonious intent, obtain from said Rielea two diamond set finger rings, of the value of $20000 contrary to the Statute in such case made and provided
These are therefor to command you forthwith to arrest said Ritchie and bring him before the Judge of our said Court to be dealt with according to Law
Witness my hand this 3d day Augt 1865
Phil Tomppert Jr C C C L

Requisition
Upon the Governor of Ohio for John Ritchie
issued 3d Aug/65

Requ
To Augt 4th 1865
Commonwealth
vs } Felony Wt
John Ritchie
